title: Associate Software Engineer - Data Intelligence
descriptionHtml:
Addepar is a global technology and data company that helps investment professionals provide informed guidance for their clients. They are seeking talented junior software engineers to work on innovative data initiatives and contribute to the development of their financial data platform.


Responsibilities

  • Help shape the future of data management in the financial world by contributing to a state-of-the-art financial lakehouse.
  • Create innovative solutions that address the evolving needs of the financial industry, enabling our clients to make data-driven decisions with confidence.
  • Design, develop, and deploy cutting-edge automated workflows and tools that drive operational efficiency, minimize manual errors, and deliver exceptional client experiences.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate automated solutions with existing systems and tools, ensuring data integrity, seamless workflows, and minimal disruptions.


Qualification


Required

  • Hold a Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field, with a strong foundation in computer systems, programming languages, and software development methodologies
  • Proficient in Python programming, with a focus on automation, scripting, and data manipulation
  • Strong ownership of your work and a willingness to take on new challenges
  • Eager to learn and grow with our team, with a focus on automation, data science, and innovation


Preferred

  • experience with PySpark, Databricks, or other big data technologies
  • experience with UI frameworks such as Streamlit or Dash

title: DevOps Engineer - Anywhere in USA
descriptionHtml:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for TWO95 International. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Hi,

Job Title : DevOps Engineer

Location : Anywhere in USA

Contract: 6+ Months

Travel: 50-70%

Rate: $Open

Responsibilities And Duties

  • Deploying, automating, maintaining and managing AWS cloud-based production system, to ensure the availability, performance, scalability, and security of productions systems.
  • Build, release and configuration management of production systems.
  • Automated applications and MySQL container deployment in Docker using Python and monitor them using Nagios.
  • Virtualized servers in Docker as per test environments and Dev-environments requirements and configured automation using Docker containers.
  • Pre-production Acceptance Testing to help assure the quality of our products/services.
  • System troubleshooting and problem solving across platform and application domains.
  • Suggesting architecture improvements, recommending process improvements.
  • Evaluate new technology options and vendor products.
  • Ensuring critical system security through the use of best in class cloud security solutions.
  • Experience with using a broad range of AWS technologies (e.g. EC2, RDS, ELB, EBD, S3, VPC, Glacier, IAM, CloudWatch, KMS) to develop and maintain anAmazon AWS based cloud solution, with an emphasis on best practice cloud security.

Note: If interested please send your updated resume and include your rate requirement along with your contact details with a suitable time when we can reach you. If you know of anyone in your sphere of contacts, who would be a perfect match for this job then, we would appreciate if you can forward this posting to them with a copy to us.

We look forward to hearing from you at the earliest!

Ajith Kumar |Sourcing Expert

TWO95 International Inc,

1101, N Kings Hwy, Suite #200 Cherry Hill ,NJ 08034.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
descriptionHtml:
This role is critical for bridging the gap between business users and the AI/ML team by documenting workflows and data structures within a legacy EHR system. It ensures machine learning efforts are grounded in real operational context while supporting user training and adoption of new features.

Requirements

  • Collaborate with clinical, administrative, and technical staff to document business workflows and -develop a deep understanding of how EHR data is captured and used.
  • Build subject matter expertise in EHR system behavior, data structures, and operational processes.
  • Author clear, comprehensive documentation, including data dictionaries, workflow diagrams, and technical notes that support knowledge transfer and model development.
  • Act as a liaison between business users and developers, particularly when new EHR features or data elements are introduced.
  • Support rollout of application updates by training users, gathering feedback, and creating reference materials to ensure smooth adoption of new workflows and data entry practices.
  • Use Python, SQL, and foundational machine learning techniques to analyze and model clinical and operational data stored in Oracle databases.
  • Clean and query large datasets to prepare training data and derive insights that feed into dashboards, reports, and predictive models.
  • Build and deploy AI/ML models integrated into tools that support decision-making and operational improvement.

title: Engineer
descriptionHtml:
AWS Data Engineer

Must Have Technical/Functional Skills

  • Strong Experience with AWS Services: S3, Lake Formation, Glue, EMR, Athena, Lambda, EventBridge, SNS, SQS
  • Proficiency in Apache Spark for distributed data processing
  • Hands on experience with Terraform or CloudFormation
  • Familiarity with Amazon Neptune DB for graph-based metadata management
  • Strong understanding of Data lake architecture, data governance and security best practices
  • Proficiency in SQL, Python and Spark for Data Engineering tasks

Nice To Have

  • Experience with RestfulAPI
  • Knowledge on Angular is nice to have

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Build, design and implement scalable data lake architecture using AWS S3 and Lakeformation
  • Build and optimize ETL Pipelines using AWS Glue, EMR and Spark
  • Implement Event-Driven workflows using EventBridge, SNS and SQS
  • Design and query datasets using Athena
  • Manage metadata and data lineage using Amazon Neptune DB
  • Expose APIs for data subscription and sharing using API Gateway and AWS Lambda
  • Automate infrastructure provisioning using Terraform and CloudFormation
  • Ensure data security and compliance by implementing robust IAM policies and access controls.
  • Develop and maintain a self-serve data portal using Angular and integrate it with backend services

Salary Range- $90,000-$120,000 a year

title: Solana Data Engineer
descriptionHtml:
I'm working with an up-and-coming crypto firm that's quietly building core infrastructure for the next phase of blockchain scalability and performance, this team is shaping the future of decentralized infrastructure and developer tooling on Solana.


They're hiring for a Solana-focused Data Engineer to design and operate high-performance data pipelines and dashboards that track real-time and historical Solana blockchain data. In this role, you'll play a key part in building out analytics infrastructure that powers internal decision-making and external tools. You'll work directly with Solana full nodes and RPCs to extract, process, and visualize critical on-chain data.


What You'll Do:

Extract raw blockchain data from Solana full nodes or RPC infrastructure

Build and optimize data pipelines ingesting on-chain data into ClickHouse (or similar OLAP systems)

Design and maintain dashboards tracking validator performance, staking, token flows, and more

Ensure high data accuracy, availability, and reliability across all analytics surfaces


What We're Looking For:

Deep experience with ClickHouse, Grafana, or similar data/visualization stacks

Strong Python and shell scripting skills

Experience with containerized environments (Docker, Kubernetes)

Familiarity with blockchain indexers or off-chain APIs


*Visa sponsorship is not available for this role*

title: Forward Deployed Engineer
descriptionHtml:
At Sea12 Technologies, we work with some of the largest public and private companies in the world - taking an executive level approach to their toughest challenges, and solving them with our technology. We specialize in critical industries, such as Manufacturing, Logistics, and Construction, and deliver results that touch millions of people every day.


As a Forward Deployed Engineer, you will work directly with our customers, boots on the ground on the factory floor and in the dispatch rooms. You will bridge the gap between frontier AI research and tangible physical impact for critical industries. One month, you may be working with a Fortune 500 Freight Brokerage, working directly with the executive team to automate customer communications with LLMs. The next month, you may be working with a major cruise line, onsite onboard their ships, helping the crew revolutionize fleet operations.


We’re well funded from leading VCs, are growing quickly, and in only months have secured enterprise scale engagements with lasting impact. If you want to build things that drive tangible outcomes you can see with your own eyes, then Sea12 is the place for you.


Experience/Responsibilities

  • Passion: Passionate about the impact of AI systems, and traditionally overlooked industries, such as manufacturing and logistics.
  • Strong Communication Skills: Ability to communicate complex ideas simply
  • Problem Scouting: Ability to identify the most high value problems to solve among a myriad of potential approaches.
  • Feedback: The ability to design and quickly iterate on strong feedback loops from customers. Prioritizing adoption over ego.
  • Travel: Ability and desire to travel often, and witness technical deployments with your own eyes.
  • Coding Experience: Strong ability Python, SQL, Javascript (Go, C# nice to have)

title: Data Scientist / Machine Learning Engineer - Personalization
descriptionHtml:
About Faire

Faire is an online wholesale marketplace built on the belief that the future is local — independent retailers around the globe are doing more revenue than Walmart and Amazon combined, but individually, they are small compared to these massive entities. At Faire, we're using the power of tech, data, and machine learning to connect this thriving community of entrepreneurs across the globe. Picture your favorite boutique in town — we help them discover the best products from around the world to sell in their stores. With the right tools and insights, we believe that we can level the playing field so that small businesses everywhere can compete with these big box and e-commerce giants.

By supporting the growth of independent businesses, Faire is driving positive economic impact in local communities, globally. We’re looking for smart, resourceful and passionate people to join us as we power the shop local movement. If you believe in community, come join ours.

About This Role

Faire leverages the power of machine learning and data insights to revolutionize the wholesale industry, enabling local retailers to compete against giants like Amazon and big box stores. Our highly skilled team of data scientists and machine learning engineers specializes in developing algorithmic solutions related to discovery, ranking, search, recommendations, ads, logistics, underwriting, and more. Our ultimate goal is to empower local retail businesses with the tools they need to succeed.

As a member of the Discovery Personalization team, you’ll be responsible for:

  • Personalization: Personalizing recommendations across surfaces of homepage, category page, brand page, and carousel recommendations, through retrieval embeddings models, near-real-time / streaming signals, Deep Learning or LLM-based ranking/recommendation models, explore-exploit, and diversification

Our team already includes experienced Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers from Uber, Airbnb, Square, Meta, LinkedIn and Pinterest. We're a lean, talented team with high opportunity for direct product impact and ownership.

You’re Excited About This Role Because…

  • You’ll be able to work on cutting-edge personalization and recommendation problems by combining a wide variety of data about our retailers, brands, and products
  • You want to use machine learning to help local retailers and independent brands succeed
  • You want to be a foundational team member of a fast-growing company
  • You like to solve challenging problems related to a two-sided marketplace

Qualifications

  • 1-3 years of relevant industry or research experience applying ML to real-world problems
  • Familiarity or experience with personalization systems or recommendation algorithms
  • Proficiency in Machine Learning / Deep Learning modeling and programming
  • An excitement and willingness to learn new tools and techniques
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to work with others in a closely collaborative team environment

Great To Haves

  • Master’s or PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, or related STEM fields
  • Experience implementing state-of-the-art ML algorithms from an academic paper
  • Exposure to graph neural networks and/or language models

Salary Range

California & New York: the pay range for this role is $162,500 to $223,500 per year.

This role will also be eligible for equity and benefits. Actual base pay will be determined based on permissible factors such as transferable skills, work experience, market demands, and primary work location. The base pay range provided is subject to change and may be modified in the future.

Effective January 2025, Faire employees will be expected to go into the office 2 days per week on Tuesdays and Thursdays. Additionally, hybrid in-office roles will have the flexibility to work remotely up to 4 weeks per year. Specific Workplace and Information Technology positions may require onsite attendance 5 days per week as will be indicated in the job posting.

Applications for this position will be accepted for a minimum of 30 days from the posting date.

Why you’ll love working at Faire

  • We are entrepreneurs: Faire is being built for entrepreneurs, by entrepreneurs. We believe entrepreneurship is a calling and our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to chase their dreams. Every member of our team is taking part in the founding process.
  • We are using technology and data to level the playing field: We are leveraging the power of product innovation and machine learning to connect brands and boutiques from all over the world, building a growing community of more than 350,000 small business owners.
  • We build products our customers love: Everything we do is ultimately in the service of helping our customers grow their business because our goal is to grow the pie - not steal a piece from it. Running a small business is hard work, but using Faire makes it easy.
  • We are curious and resourceful: Inquisitive by default, we explore every possibility, test every assumption, and develop creative solutions to the challenges at hand. We lead with curiosity and data in our decision making, and reason from a first principles mentality.

Faire was founded in 2017 by a team of early product and engineering leads from Square. We’re backed by some of the top investors in retail and tech including: Y Combinator, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Forerunner Ventures, Khosla Ventures, Sequoia Capital, Founders Fund, and DST Global. We have headquarters in San Francisco and Kitchener-Waterloo, and a global employee presence across offices in Toronto, London, and New York. To learn more about Faire and our customers, you can read more on our blog.

Faire provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression.

Faire is committed to providing access, equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. Accommodations are available throughout the recruitment process and applicants with a disability may request to be accommodated throughout the recruitment process. We will work with all applicants to accommodate their individual accessibility needs. To request reasonable accommodation, please fill out our Accommodation Request Form (https://bit.ly/faire-form)

Running a small business is hard work, but using Faire makes it easy.We are curious and resourceful: Inquisitive by default, we explore every possibility, test every assumption, and develop creative solutions to the challenges at hand. We lead with curiosity and data in our decision making, and reason from a first principles mentality.Faire was founded in 2017 by a team of early product and engineering leads from Square. We’re backed by some of the top investors in retail and tech including: Y Combinator, Lightspeed Venture Partners, Forerunner Ventures, Khosla Ventures, Sequoia Capital, Founders Fund, and DST Global. We have headquarters in San Francisco and Kitchener-Waterloo, and a global employee presence across offices in Toronto, London, and New York. To learn more about Faire and our customers, you can read more on our blog.Faire provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, genetics, sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression.Faire is committed to providing access, equal opportunity and reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities in employment, its services, programs, and activities. Accommodations are available throughout the recruitment process and applicants with a disability may request to be accommodated throughout the recruitment process. We will work with all applicants to accommodate their individual accessibility needs. To request reasonable accommodation, please fill out our Accommodation Request Form (https://bit.ly/faire-form)
companyDescription: Faire is the wholesale marketplace empowering brands and retailers to strengthen the unique character of local communities.
companySlogan: The future is local

title: Solutions Engineer, Operations
descriptionHtml:
Opto is engineering the future of private markets to improve client outcomes and drive capital to the most transformative ideas.

The opportunity is huge. The global alternative investments industry was worth an estimated $16.8T at the end of 2023, but is forecast to grow to $29.2T by 2029. But the private investment process typically remains opaque, highly manual, and error-prone, which limits access to the select few insiders who are willing to bear the pain.

Opto is a revolutionary end-to-end solution for wealth managers of any size - from small investment advisors to large multi-family offices to private banks - to build, fundraise for, and manage private markets programs at scale. We combine exceptional Silicon Valley engineering talent with experienced investors and industry specialists to fix this broken system through the power of technology. Our platform banishes the nightmare of slide decks, spreadsheets, and paperwork to the past, and arms our clients with the tools, data, and guidance to identify and access the right opportunities for their clients.

Fixing private markets will not be easy and demands courage, but we’re not afraid to do things differently. We are unapologetically bold. We value strong opinions, clear communication, and purposeful execution.

Up for the challenge? Come join us.

About The Role

You will be an integral part of a close-knit Operations team, participating in all aspects of operational, fund administration, compliance, audit, and tax functions. As a Solutions Engineer, you will partner with Operations to help identify problems and create solutions, which may include building custom data integrations, extending platform capabilities, and more.

Solutions Engineers at Opto face the challenge of turning complex business problems into elegant and pragmatic engineering solutions. If you are a technology enthusiast looking to break into a technical role and solve challenging problems with us, you could be a good fit here. This unique opportunity offers significant ownership and a chance to gain both technical and business experience, allowing you to shape your career trajectory.

Required Skills

  • Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Javascript, and/or SQL
  • Solid understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software design principles
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment
  • Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
  • Strong bias toward tool building and process optimization over repetitive work
  • Ability to abstract complex problems into elegant technical solutions
  • Familiarity with accounting software and investment funds
  • Knowledge of GAAP is a plus
  • Solid organizational and time-management skills
  • Capable of multitasking in a daily, deadline-driven environment while keeping others well-informed

Background

  • 1+ years of work experience at an audit firm, fund administrator, similar Fintech platform, or investment firm
  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience

How To Apply

Please fill out the below fields, and attach a Resume and Cover Letter. Why a Cover Letter? We receive a high volume of applicants, and we have real humans that read each and every resume, we encourage you to use creativity in your Cover Letter and speak directly to why you want to join our team!

We will review your resume in as timely a manner as we are able to, so kindly refrain from reaching out to hiring managers or other Opto team members via email or linkedin, as this won't improve or fast track your application.

Compensation And Benefits

Opto has a high bar for talent, and we are committed to building the best teams possible. Candidates are never subjected to discrimination based on race, citizenship, religion, ethnicity, gender or gender identity, sex, pregnancy, national origin, age, sensory, mental, or physical disability, or any other characteristic.

The successful candidate for this role can expect a generous compensation and benefits package. The cash salary range for this role is $95,000-$125,000 dependent on skills, experience and expected contribution.

All full time employees at Opto enjoy:

  • Significant equity
  • Health, dental, and vision insurance
  • Unlimited PTO
  • Retirement savings plan (401k)
  • Learning, Fitness, Commuter & WFH stipends
  • Paid Holidays

This position is based primarily onsite in either our San Francisco or New York City offices.

companyDescription:
Opto Investments (“Opto”) is engineering the future of private markets, offering the solution for wealth managers to efficiently build and manage differentiated private investment programs.

Opto’s end-to-end technology solution dramatically streamlines building, fundraising for, and managing a bespoke private markets fund or program, allowing independent investment advisors, family offices, and private banks to scale their offerings without scaling their team.

Founded by Joe Lonsdale, the entrepreneur behind Palantir and Addepar, and backed by investors including 8VC and Michael Dell’s DFO Management, Opto set out to forge a business free from the faulty legacy incentives on which private markets investing is built. Opto is not compensated by fund managers to offer funds, which enables an undiluted focus on quality. When Opto recommends an investment, it's with purpose. When they pass, it's with conviction. Clients can combine their best ideas with Opto’s in a bespoke partnership tailored to their needs.

Opto’s platform automates admin processes across the entire private markets investment journey, saving advisors hours of time inputting client data, creating compelling proposals, completing subscription documents, managing capital calls, and delivering client communications.
companySlogan: Engineering the future of private markets

title: C++ Low Latency Trading Systems Dev-NYC- 150-300K Base+Bonus
descriptionHtml:
C++ Low Latency Trading Systems Developer - Manhattan, New York - 150 - 300 K Base Plus Bonus

A trading firm in NYC is hiring C++ engineers to their low latency trading systems technology team. Relative experience in finance is ideal, but the team is open to excellent low latency candidates from out of industry. Excellent C++ experience is a must with STL/Boost, Linux/Unix, etc.

Anticipated annual base salary range is around 150 - 300 K plus bonus.

To find out more about Huxley, please visit www.huxley.com

Shaping the future of finance

Huxley is an IT specialist, part of SThree, the global STEM workforce consultancy. With expertise in financial technology, business intelligence and strategic transformation, Huxley advises businesses, builds expert teams and delivers project solutions.

Our consultants are truly specialised— focusing on regional market requirements. This allows us to provide organisations with market-specific advice, and place the right professionals into the right projects.

We deliver a high-quality service that is fully compliant, regularly audited, and meets regulations and standards locally and globally. The organisations and professionals we partner with benefit from our deep sector expertise, our local and global experience, and our dedicated service. This is how we outpace tomorrow, together.

title: CONSULTANT DÉVELOPPEUR JAVA H/F – NEW YORK
descriptionHtml:
• Offres d'emploi
  • Consultant Développeur JAVA H/F - New York

Détails de L’OFFRE

Dans le cadre du renforcement de nos équipes New-Yorkaise, nous recrutons un(e) consultant(e) JAVA Developpement. En tant que consultant développeur JAVA, vous travaillerez pour notre client afin d’améliorer les systèmes électroniques de marché dans le domaine de la finance (front office/trading side).

La banque est présente dans 80 pays et emploie près de 200 000 personnes, dont plus de 150 000 en Europe. Elle occupe une place de choix dans ses trois activités principales : Banque de détail, Solutions d’investissement et Banque de financement et d’investissement.

L’équipe de développement fait partie d’une équipe de tarification globale et de technologie des marchés électroniques qui développe les systèmes utilisés pour l’activité de négociation. Il s’agit d’une équipe de front office qui travaille directement avec les traders et la direction de l’entreprise pour fournir des solutions de haute qualité à la fois localement et dans le cadre des plates-formes. Il s’agit d’un poste de contractuel dans un premier temps, avec la possibilité de devenir permanent.

Vos MISSIONS

  • Concevoir et développer des applications distribuées de tarification et de marchés électroniques en tant que membre d’une équipe de développement mondiale.
  • Travailler avec les traders, les développeurs, les analystes commerciaux et les fournisseurs pour déterminer les exigences fonctionnelles et les plans d’intégration des applications.
  • Fournir une assistance de deuxième ligne pour les applications destinées aux utilisateurs du front-office.

Votre PROFIL

  • Compétences et connaissances de base éprouvées en Java.
  • Expérience d’un environnement de trading front-office
  • Capacité à concevoir et à développer des solutions évolutives faciles à maintenir et à supporter.
  • Une bonne compréhension du modèle de mémoire Java et du développement multithreading.
  • Connaissance du SDLC et expérience préalable dans le cadre de grands projets de développement de logiciels.
  • Capacité à avoir une vue d’ensemble pour prendre en compte les dépendances du système, les cas d’espèce et l’impact des changements dans la fourniture de solutions robustes.
  • Expérience préalable dans le développement de systèmes de négociation électronique.
  • Connaissance des produits de taux d’intérêt (Treasuries, IR Swaps, etc.) et de leur cycle de négociation.
  • Expérience préalable au sein d’une grande banque d’investissement internationale, en particulier dans un environnement de front office (trading) de produits à revenu fixe.
  • Maîtrise du langage SQL et expérience de travail avec SQL Server et/ou Oracle.
  • Expérience préalable des services de négociation ION (connectivité, STP, RFQ, VMO et MMI).
  • Connaissance de TIBCO Rendezvous.
  • Python

Vos COMPÉTENCES

  • Solides compétences en matière de résolution de problèmes et d’analyse.
  • Solides compétences interpersonnelles.
  • Capacité à travailler au sein d’une équipe internationale.

Notre ENGAGEMENT DIVERSITÉ

Quanteam et le Groupe Rainbow Partners sont des entreprises handi-accueillantes et s’engagent en faveur de l’égalité professionnelle, de la mixité et de la diversité. Elles sont ouvertes à tous les talents et encouragent, à ce titre, toute personne possédant les compétences mentionnées dans la présente offre, à soumettre sa candidature.

Quanteam et le Groupe Rainbow Partners proposent un modèle d’entreprise axé sur la responsabilité, l’engagement, la gestion responsable et s’engagent pour le développement durable et le respect de l’environnement.

À propos de Quanteam

Quanteam (entité du Groupe Rainbow Partners) est un cabinet de conseil spécialisé dans les secteurs Banque, Finance et Services financiers.

Nos 850 consultants, issus de 35 nationalités différentes, sont situés à Paris, Lyon, Londres, New-York, Montréal, Genève, Lisbonne, Porto, Bruxelles, Casablanca, Madrid et Singapour.

Fort d’une double compétence métier et IT, Quanteam accompagne ses clients grands comptes (banques de financement et d’investissement, sociétés de gestion d’actif, banques privées et de détail, dépositaires de titres…) sur l’ensemble de la chaine Front-to-Back, dans l’évolution de leurs activités métiers et dans leurs projets de Transformation.

Nos équipes sont organisées autour de 5 pôles d’expertises :

  • Finance quantitative
  • Risques, Conformité et Réglementaire
  • Opérations et Finance
  • Transformation et Organisation
  • IT et Système d’information

La vie chez Quanteam

Si vous êtes un être humain et que vous voyez ce champ, veuillez le laisser vide.

Ils vous en parlent

La satisfaction d’être reconnu pour son travail et d’évoluer dans une bonne ambiance

Geoffroy, Consultant Expert – Practice Finance Quantitative

Après des études en Ingénierie et un Master de Recherche en Nanotechnologie, j’ai travaillé dans les secteurs de l’Energie et du Retail, au sein de cabinets de conseil / ESN du Big Four. Puis j’ai rejoint Quanteam, en 2018, en tant que Développeur Full Stack sur des problématiques de produits structurés et produits exotiques au sein d’une grande banque française. J’avais déjà le souhait de m’orienter vers le secteur de la Banque / Finance, sur lequel j’avais commencé à me former, et j’ai été rassuré de voir que, à travers son process de recrutement sélectif, Quanteam était un acteur incontournable du marché. Dès le début, j’ai senti le soutien du cabinet dans l’accompagnement de ses consultants, via la formation. Grâce à Quanteam, j’ai d’ailleurs pu renforcer mes compétences à travers un Master en Finance Quantitative, en cours du soir, qui m’a permis d’intégrer la Practice Quant et de conjuguer mes compétences techniques à ma compréhension des problématiques Métiers, Business et Fonctionnelles.

Je souhaitais rejoindre un acteur du conseil en Banque / Finance

Salim, Senior Business Manager chez Quanteam

J’ai choisi de rejoindre le cabinet en 2020 et je suis très heureux d’y occuper un poste complet au sein d’une entreprise humaine, qui favorise la montée en compétences et qui sait reconnaitre le travail accompli. Il y a une vraie émulsion entre les équipes ainsi qu’une bonne ambiance qu’on retrouve au quotidien ou lors des afterworks et des évènements du cabinet. La proximité que nous entretenons soigneusement avec nos clients ainsi que nos consultants est à l’image de celle qui existe en interne avec les équipes et avec la direction. Plus que tout, j’ai le sentiment que le travail est reconnu à sa juste valeur et qu’il a un impact direct sur l’évolution de carrière.

J’ai toujours eu des missions géniales chez QUANTEAM

François, Consultant Manager – Practice Finance Quantitative

Ingénieur de formation, j’ai rejoint les équipes de Quanteam il y a plus de 10 ans, après une expérience mitigée dans un cabinet de conseil concurrent. C’est la mission proposée qui m’a attiré en premier lieu (support pre-trade en salle de marché) , mais ce sont les valeurs humaines et l’accompagnement dont fait preuve le cabinet qui m’a fait rester. J’ai toujours eu des missions géniales chez Quanteam. J’ai pu rejoidre le bureau de Londres, pendant plusieurs mois, et j’ai évolué grâce aux nombreuses opportunités de postes internes. Quanteam est très bien référencé chez nos clients et le cabinet propose de belles missions, avec de beaux challenges techniques et fonctionnels. Pour ceux qui attendent plus qu’une simple mission de la part d’un cabinet, Quanteam est l’endroit idéal.

De belles missions dans le secteur Bancaire et une proximité dès les premiers échanges

Ghaoutia, Consultante Manager – Practice Transformation et Organisation

Après un passage au sein de plusieurs cabinets de conseil et ESN, essentiellement sur des missions de chefferie / direction de Projets MOA, j’ai rejoint Quanteam en 2021. J’avais une très belle proposition côté éditeur, mais j’ai rapidement senti un feeling humain et une sensation de bienveillance lors de mes premiers échanges avec Quanteam, qui ont fait la différence et qui m’ont convaincue de rejoindre le cabinet. La qualité et la diversité des missions proposées dans le secteur Bancaire, domaine de prédilection du cabinet, étaient également un atout non négligeable pour moi. J’ai d’ailleurs pu réaliser deux belles missions (direction de projets et de conseil) et j’ai pu coacher des consultants en amont de leurs entretiens de missions. Deux ans après, je ne regrette pas mon choix. Je retrouve cette proximité et cette volonté de collaborer, au quotidien, notamment avec l’équipe commerciale mais également au sein des équipes projets.

Chacun peut trouver sa place et évoluer

Marc, Chef de projet MOA chez Quanteam / co-directeur de la Practice Operations & Finance

Je suis consultant depuis plus de 20 ans, au sein de différentes Banques et Assurances. J’ai rejoint le bureau parisien de Quanteam il y a 7 ans car j’ai apprécié les valeurs humaines lors des premières rencontres, valeurs que je partage au quotidien. La direction reste également très accessible et transparente dans ses échanges avec les collaborateurs du cabinet, comme ce fut le cas lors de la période COVID. Ce qui est d’autant plus appréciable que ce n’a pas été le cas partout. Enfin, les missions proposées diversifiées et variées permettent à chacun et chacune de s’enrichir professionnellement et personnellement.

La liberté de choisir ses missions est très appréciable

Mathieu, Consultant Manager – Practice Transformation et Organisation

J’ai rejoint Quanteam en 2019, après plusieurs expériences dans le conseil, en tant qu’Analyste Equity Derivatives, puis comme Chef de Projets IT. J’occupe aujourd’hui un rôle de Scrum Master / BA au sein d’une équipe anti-fraude. Ce qui me plaît chez Quanteam, c’est la richesse et la diversité des missions proposées, et la forte implantation du cabinet sur les secteurs bancaires et financiers. Le cabinet écoute les souhaits de ses consultants et leurs donne le choix des missions, ce qui n’est pas le cas partout. En termes d’évolution, j’ai souhaité intégrer la Practice Transformation et Organisation afin d’acquérir de nouvelles compétences, grâce aux experts qui la compose. J’ai réalisé plusieurs formations certifiantes, ce qui me donne vraiment l’impression que le cabinet investi sur moi.

La satisfaction d’être reconnu pour son travail et d’évoluer dans une bonne ambiance

Geoffroy, Consultant Expert – Practice Finance Quantitative

Après des études en Ingénierie et un Master de Recherche en Nanotechnologie, j’ai travaillé dans les secteurs de l’Energie et du Retail, au sein de cabinets de conseil / ESN du Big Four. En tant que consultant développeur JAVA, vous travaillerez pour notre client afin d’améliorer les systèmes électroniques de marché dans le domaine de la finance (front office/trading side).La banque est présente dans 80 pays et emploie près de 200 000 personnes, dont plus de 150 000 en Europe. Elle occupe une place de choix dans ses trois activités principales : Banque de détail, Solutions d’investissement et Banque de financement et d’investissement.L’équipe de développement fait partie d’une équipe de tarification globale et de technologie des marchés électroniques qui développe les systèmes utilisés pour l’activité de négociation. Il s’agit d’une équipe de front office qui travaille directement avec les traders et la direction de l’entreprise pour fournir des solutions de haute qualité à la fois localement et dans le cadre des plates-formes. Il s’agit d’un poste de contractuel dans un premier temps, avec la possibilité de devenir permanent.Vos MISSIONSConcevoir et développer des applications distribuées de tarification et de marchés électroniques en tant que membre d’une équipe de développement mondiale.Travailler avec les traders, les développeurs, les analystes commerciaux et les fournisseurs pour déterminer les exigences fonctionnelles et les plans d’intégration des applications.Fournir une assistance de deuxième ligne pour les applications destinées aux utilisateurs du front-office.Votre PROFILCompétences et connaissances de base éprouvées en Java.Expérience d’un environnement de trading front-officeCapacité à concevoir et à développer des solutions évolutives faciles à maintenir et à supporter.Une bonne compréhension du modèle de mémoire Java et du développement multithreading.Connaissance du SDLC et expérience préalable dans le cadre de grands projets de développement de logiciels.Capacité à avoir une vue d’ensemble pour prendre en compte les dépendances du système, les cas d’espèce et l’impact des changements dans la fourniture de solutions robustes.Expérience préalable dans le développement de systèmes de négociation électronique.Connaissance des produits de taux d’intérêt (Treasuries, IR Swaps, etc.) et de leur cycle de négociation.Expérience préalable au sein d’une grande banque d’investissement internationale, en particulier dans un environnement de front office (trading) de produits à revenu fixe.Maîtrise du langage SQL et expérience de travail avec SQL Server et/ou Oracle.Expérience préalable des services de négociation ION (connectivité, STP, RFQ, VMO et MMI).Connaissance de TIBCO Rendezvous.PythonVos COMPÉTENCESSolides compétences en matière de résolution de problèmes et d’analyse.Solides compétences interpersonnelles.Capacité à travailler au sein d’une équipe internationale.Notre ENGAGEMENT DIVERSITÉQuanteam et le Groupe Rainbow Partners sont des entreprises handi-accueillantes et s’engagent en faveur de l’égalité professionnelle, de la mixité et de la diversité. Elles sont ouvertes à tous les talents et encouragent, à ce titre, toute personne possédant les compétences mentionnées dans la présente offre, à soumettre sa candidature.Quanteam et le Groupe Rainbow Partners proposent un modèle d’entreprise axé sur la responsabilité, l’engagement, la gestion responsable et s’engagent pour le développement durable et le respect de l’environnement.À propos de QuanteamQuanteam (entité du Groupe Rainbow Partners) est un cabinet de conseil spécialisé dans les secteurs Banque, Finance et Services financiers.Nos 850 consultants, issus de 35 nationalités différentes, sont situés à Paris, Lyon, Londres, New-York, Montréal, Genève, Lisbonne, Porto, Bruxelles, Casablanca, Madrid et Singapour.Fort d’une double compétence métier et IT, Quanteam accompagne ses clients grands comptes (banques de financement et d’investissement, sociétés de gestion d’actif, banques privées et de détail, dépositaires de titres…) sur l’ensemble de la chaine Front-to-Back, dans l’évolution de leurs activités métiers et dans leurs projets de Transformation.Nos équipes sont organisées autour de 5 pôles d’expertises :Finance quantitativeRisques, Conformité et RéglementaireOpérations et FinanceTransformation et OrganisationIT et Système d’informationLa vie chez QuanteamPourquoi nous rejoindre ?Votre accélérateur de carrièreLa vie chez QuanteamPourquoi nous rejoindre ?Les témoignages denos consultantsConsulter nos témoignagesCETTE OFFRE VOUS INTÉRESSE ?PostulerLes champs marqués d’un * sont obligatoiresPrénom *Nom *E-mail *Tél.Ville *Code postal *Joindre un CV *Joindre une lettre de motivationVotre message à l'employeur *5000 sur 5000 Caractère(s)J’autorise Quanteam et ses cabinets partenaires à utiliser les informations fournies pour me contacter dans le cadre d’opportunités professionnelles *RGPDLes Informations Collectées Sur Ce Formulaire Sont Utilisées Par Le Cabinet QUANTEAM Afin De Traiter Votre Demande D’informations Et Sont Transmises Au Service Concerné Pour Pouvoir Traiter Votre Demande. Vous Pouvez Accéder, Modifier, Faire Valoir Votre Droit à La Portabilité, Faire Supprimer Toute Données Vous Concernant, Demander La Limitation Du Traitement De Vos Données, Retirer Votre Consentement Et Vous Opposer Au Traitement De Vos Données En Vous Adressant Par Courrier Postal à L’adresse SuivanteQuanteam–Service Communication–8, rue Euler 75008 ParisOu Par Courrier Électronique à L’adresse Suivantedpo@quanteam.fr.Pour plus d’informations sur la gestion de vos données et vos droits, consultez notre politique de protection des données personnelles.Si vous êtes un être humain et que vous voyez ce champ, veuillez le laisser vide.Ils vous en parlentLa satisfaction d’être reconnu pour son travail et d’évoluer dans une bonne ambianceGeoffroy, Consultant Expert – Practice Finance QuantitativeAprès des études en Ingénierie et un Master de Recherche en Nanotechnologie, j’ai travaillé dans les secteurs de l’Energie et du Retail, au sein de cabinets de conseil / ESN du Big Four. Puis j’ai rejoint Quanteam, en 2018, en tant que Développeur Full Stack sur des problématiques de produits structurés et produits exotiques au sein d’une grande banque française. J’avais déjà le souhait de m’orienter vers le secteur de la Banque / Finance, sur lequel j’avais commencé à me former, et j’ai été rassuré de voir que, à travers son process de recrutement sélectif, Quanteam était un acteur incontournable du marché. Dès le début, j’ai senti le soutien du cabinet dans l’accompagnement de ses consultants, via la formation. Grâce à Quanteam, j’ai d’ailleurs pu renforcer mes compétences à travers un Master en Finance Quantitative, en cours du soir, qui m’a permis d’intégrer la Practice Quant et de conjuguer mes compétences techniques à ma compréhension des problématiques Métiers, Business et Fonctionnelles.Je souhaitais rejoindre un acteur du conseil en Banque / FinanceSalim, Senior Business Manager chez QuanteamJ’ai choisi de rejoindre le cabinet en 2020 et je suis très heureux d’y occuper un poste complet au sein d’une entreprise humaine, qui favorise la montée en compétences et qui sait reconnaitre le travail accompli. Il y a une vraie émulsion entre les équipes ainsi qu’une bonne ambiance qu’on retrouve au quotidien ou lors des afterworks et des évènements du cabinet. La proximité que nous entretenons soigneusement avec nos clients ainsi que nos consultants est à l’image de celle qui existe en interne avec les équipes et avec la direction. Plus que tout, j’ai le sentiment que le travail est reconnu à sa juste valeur et qu’il a un impact direct sur l’évolution de carrière.J’ai toujours eu des missions géniales chez QUANTEAMFrançois, Consultant Manager – Practice Finance QuantitativeIngénieur de formation, j’ai rejoint les équipes de Quanteam il y a plus de 10 ans, après une expérience mitigée dans un cabinet de conseil concurrent. C’est la mission proposée qui m’a attiré en premier lieu (support pre-trade en salle de marché) , mais ce sont les valeurs humaines et l’accompagnement dont fait preuve le cabinet qui m’a fait rester. J’ai toujours eu des missions géniales chez Quanteam. J’ai pu rejoidre le bureau de Londres, pendant plusieurs mois, et j’ai évolué grâce aux nombreuses opportunités de postes internes. Quanteam est très bien référencé chez nos clients et le cabinet propose de belles missions, avec de beaux challenges techniques et fonctionnels. Pour ceux qui attendent plus qu’une simple mission de la part d’un cabinet, Quanteam est l’endroit idéal.De belles missions dans le secteur Bancaire et une proximité dès les premiers échangesGhaoutia, Consultante Manager – Practice Transformation et OrganisationAprès un passage au sein de plusieurs cabinets de conseil et ESN, essentiellement sur des missions de chefferie / direction de Projets MOA, j’ai rejoint Quanteam en 2021. J’avais une très belle proposition côté éditeur, mais j’ai rapidement senti un feeling humain et une sensation de bienveillance lors de mes premiers échanges avec Quanteam, qui ont fait la différence et qui m’ont convaincue de rejoindre le cabinet. La qualité et la diversité des missions proposées dans le secteur Bancaire, domaine de prédilection du cabinet, étaient également un atout non négligeable pour moi. J’ai d’ailleurs pu réaliser deux belles missions (direction de projets et de conseil) et j’ai pu coacher des consultants en amont de leurs entretiens de missions. Deux ans après, je ne regrette pas mon choix. Je retrouve cette proximité et cette volonté de collaborer, au quotidien, notamment avec l’équipe commerciale mais également au sein des équipes projets.Chacun peut trouver sa place et évoluerMarc, Chef de projet MOA chez Quanteam / co-directeur de la Practice Operations & FinanceJe suis consultant depuis plus de 20 ans, au sein de différentes Banques et Assurances. J’ai rejoint le bureau parisien de Quanteam il y a 7 ans car j’ai apprécié les valeurs humaines lors des premières rencontres, valeurs que je partage au quotidien. La direction reste également très accessible et transparente dans ses échanges avec les collaborateurs du cabinet, comme ce fut le cas lors de la période COVID. Ce qui est d’autant plus appréciable que ce n’a pas été le cas partout. Enfin, les missions proposées diversifiées et variées permettent à chacun et chacune de s’enrichir professionnellement et personnellement.La liberté de choisir ses missions est très appréciableMathieu, Consultant Manager – Practice Transformation et OrganisationJ’ai rejoint Quanteam en 2019, après plusieurs expériences dans le conseil, en tant qu’Analyste Equity Derivatives, puis comme Chef de Projets IT. J’occupe aujourd’hui un rôle de Scrum Master / BA au sein d’une équipe anti-fraude. Ce qui me plaît chez Quanteam, c’est la richesse et la diversité des missions proposées, et la forte implantation du cabinet sur les secteurs bancaires et financiers. Le cabinet écoute les souhaits de ses consultants et leurs donne le choix des missions, ce qui n’est pas le cas partout. En termes d’évolution, j’ai souhaité intégrer la Practice Transformation et Organisation afin d’acquérir de nouvelles compétences, grâce aux experts qui la compose. J’ai réalisé plusieurs formations certifiantes, ce qui me donne vraiment l’impression que le cabinet investi sur moi.La satisfaction d’être reconnu pour son travail et d’évoluer dans une bonne ambianceGeoffroy, Consultant Expert – Practice Finance QuantitativeAprès des études en Ingénierie et un Master de Recherche en Nanotechnologie, j’ai travaillé dans les secteurs de l’Energie et du Retail, au sein de cabinets de conseil / ESN du Big Four. J’avais déjà le souhait de m’orienter vers le secteur de la Banque / Finance, sur lequel j’avais commencé à me former, et j’ai été rassuré de voir que, à travers son process de recrutement sélectif, Quanteam était un acteur incontournable du marché. Grâce à Quanteam, j’ai d’ailleurs pu renforcer mes compétences à travers un Master en Finance Quantitative, en cours du soir, qui m’a permis d’intégrer la Practice Quant et de conjuguer mes compétences techniques à ma compréhension des problématiques Métiers, Business et Fonctionnelles.Je souhaitais rejoindre un acteur du conseil en Banque / FinanceSalim, Senior Business Manager chez QuanteamJ’ai choisi de rejoindre le cabinet en 2020 et je suis très heureux d’y occuper un poste complet au sein d’une entreprise humaine, qui favorise la montée en compétences et qui sait reconnaitre le travail accompli. companyDescription:
🤔 About us?

As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specialized in Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Through our core human values – proximity, teamwork, diversity, excellence – our 850 expert consultants, hailing from 35 different nationalities, collaborate across 13 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Luxembourg, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto, Casablanca, Madrid and Singapore. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), Quanteam values diversity (gender diversity index: 91%), and promotes QWL (Best Workplace Experience).

🚀 Our expertise

With a dual business and IT competence, Quanteam supports its large corporate clients (investment and financing banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, securities depositaries, etc.) across the Front-to-Back chain, in evolving their business activities and Transformation projects.

Our teams are organized around 5 areas of expertise:
➡ Quantitative Analysis
➡ Risks, Compliance, and Regulatory
➡ Operations and Finance
➡ Transformation and Organization
➡ Information Systems

In 2024, Quanteam generated a turnover of €88 million.

🔥 Our difference

    Historical legitimacy and rooted expertise
    Dual Business and IT competence, driven by expert communities
    Human values and a tailor-made career path
    Presence in France and internationally

📧 Experts awaiting you!
Send us your application at recrutement@quanteam.fr or on https://quanteam.fr/offres-demploi/

Quanteam is an entity of the multi-specialist consulting group RAINBOW PARTNERS. In 2024, RAINBOW PARTNERS had a turnover of over €128 million, 1030 employees, 89 large corporate clients, and a presence in Europe, the United States, Canada, and North Africa. More information at https://www.rainbowpartners.com/
companySlogan: The Historical pure-play consulting firm in Banking and Finance - France and Abroad

title: AI Automation Specialist
descriptionHtml:
Job Title: AI Automation Specialist

Location: New York, NY - On-Site

Join a dynamic team at a fast-growing organization that specializes in leveraging cutting-edge technology to transform operational efficiency across industries. We are seeking an AI Automation Specialist to help design, implement, and optimize intelligent automation solutions that streamline workflows and enhance productivity.

What You'll Do:

  • Develop and deploy AI-driven automation workflows using tools like Python, RPA platforms, and large language models (LLMs).
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify automation opportunities and translate business needs into scalable AI solutions.
  • Integrate machine learning models and natural language processing (NLP) capabilities into existing systems to improve decision-making and reduce manual effort.
  • Monitor and maintain automation pipelines, ensuring reliability, scalability, and performance.
  • Stay up-to-date with emerging AI technologies and recommend innovative approaches to automation challenges.

What We're Looking For:

  • Proven experience in AI, machine learning, or automation engineering.
  • Proficiency in Python and familiarity with automation tools such as UiPath, Power Automate, or similar.
  • Experience working with APIs, cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP), and data pipelines.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.
  • Excellent communication skills and a collaborative mindset.

Nice to Have:

  • Experience with LLMs (e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic) and prompt engineering.
  • Background in process optimization or operations.
  • Familiarity with MLOps and DevOps practices.

Extraordinary technological changes continue to drive the next chapter in human development. The Fourth Industrial Revolution is fundamentally disrupting how we live, work and relate to one another; fusing the physical, digital and biological worlds. There has never been a more significant time to work in technology.  

At Glocomms, we are proud to be a leading specialist talent partner in this thriving sector. Founded in 2013, we help clients solve the number one challenge: talent. title: SAP ABAP Developer
descriptionHtml:
Job Number: 25-04713

Want to be part of the Energy Industry? ECLARO is looking for a SAP ABAP Developer for our client in White Plains, NY.

ECLARO's Client is America's largest state power organization and is a national leader in energy efficiency and clean energy technology. If you’re up to the challenge, then take a chance at this rewarding opportunity!

Project Overview:

  • Resource will be working on multiple ABAP and BW initiatives like compliance requirements, reporting ,troubleshoot configuration issues etc.
  • Resource is expected to work very closely with Business.
  • Maintain tracker for requests.
  • Have periodic meetings with business to exchange status and priorities.
  • Resource is also work closely with SAP Portfolio manager to follow SAP development standards.

Pay Rate: $65.00-$70.00/Hour

Responsibilities:

  • Prepared Technical Specification, Unit Test Plan, Implementation Plan and User Training.
  • Configure HR module as per the business requirements.
  • Designed and develop SAP ABAP and BW objects (reports, forms, enhancements) to meet RICEFW requirements.
  • Follow Object Oriented Programming practice.
  • Follow CTS process.

Required Skills:

  • Proficiency in HR ABAP Programming.
  • Familiarity with Infotypes.
  • Experience with RICEF object.
  • At least 5 years of experience in SAP ABAP with focus on HR - Workflows, Reports, Dialog Programming, Interfaces, Smart Forms, Scripts, Adobe Forms, Web Dynpro, Enhancement Framework.
  • Good to have SAP HR functional/configuration knowledge.
  • Experience with payroll schema and configuration.
  • Perform end to end development activities - Building prototypes, Effort estimation, Writing Technical design, Development, Unit Testing, Code Review, Production support, UAT/System/Integration testing support, Deployment.
  • Expert in ABAP debugging and should have ability to analyze existing processes/program and provide innovative solutions.

If hired, you will enjoy the following ECLARO Benefits:

  • 401k Retirement Savings Plan administered by Merrill Lynch
  • Commuter Check Pretax Commuter Benefits
  • Eligibility to purchase Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance through ECLARO

If interested, you may contact:

Joshua Molina

Joshua.Molina@eclaro.com

(646) 695-2923

Equal Opportunity Employer: ECLARO values diversity and does not discriminate based on Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status, in compliance with all applicable laws.

companyDescription:
ECLARO is an award-winning professional services firm headquartered in New York City and operating in the U.S., Canada and the Philippines. We deliver best-in-class talent solutions through strategic staffing, custom outsourcing & offshoring, and permanent placement for global clients ranging from innovative start-ups to Fortune 50 companies. Every client experience is bespoke, never one size fits all.

Our passion is building long-term relationships, collaborating on creative solutions and solving unique challenges by providing the right people with the right expertise for every business. Giving back to our communities, supporting our employees and serving our clients are the inspiration for our philosophy: the Right People are the Answer.

Strategic Staffing and Permanent Placement: ECLARO recruits and manages highly skilled technical and business professionals, allowing our clients to supplement their internal capabilities and staff. We offer recruiting for permanent placement as well as retained search of professionals and executives, delivering a superior selection of candidates to meet client needs. 

Custom Outsourcing & Offshoring: Through our three global services delivery centers in Metro Manila in the Philippines, ECLARO provides dedicated IT and business professionals for myriad industries. Our customized engagement model enables our clients to boost productivity with superior talent and lower costs while maintaining operational control. 

Honors & Awards Include:
Best of Staffing Talent and Client - 2023 (ClearlyRated)
2023 Global Outsourcing 100 (IAOP and FORTUNE)
Top 10 BPO (Outsource Accelerator)
2023 OA Outsourcing Impact Award for Education
Global Impact Sourcing Award (IAOP and Rockefeller Foundation)

Visit ECLARO.COM to learn more.
companySlogan: the Right People are the Answer

title: Trading Systems Dev
descriptionHtml:
An up and coming multi-strategy hedge fund is looking to hire a Trading Systems Developer to support the growth of its systematic trading business. The firm trades globally across multiple asset classes and investment approaches, and operates in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where technology is central to investment success. This role is critical to the firm's continued expansion and will work directly with investment teams to launch new systematic strategies and enhance the proprietary trading platform.

The ideal candidate will have 5+ years of experience developing cross-asset, systematic, or high-frequency trading systems, with strong expertise in C++ and Python. Prior experience with OMS/EMS infrastructure, FIX protocol, and market data systems is highly desirable.

*This role is not eligible for visa sponsorship*

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with investment teams to develop infrastructure for new systematic strategies
  • Design and maintain high-performance trading and order management systems
  • Build and improve backtesting and simulation frameworks for automated strategies
  • Implement real-time market data processing and integration
  • Develop and optimize straight-through-processing (STP) systems
  • Enhance and maintain trading platform performance and reliability


Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience in trading system or low-latency software development
  • Strong C/C++ development experience on Linux platforms
  • Proficiency in Python for scripting and systems integration
  • Experience with strategy automation and backtesting environments
  • Knowledge of EMS/OMS architectures and STP workflows
  • Real-time market data development experience
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent experience

This role is critical to the firm's continued expansion and will work directly with investment teams to launch new systematic strategies and enhance the proprietary trading platform. The ideal candidate will have 5+ years of experience developing cross-asset, systematic, or high-frequency trading systems, with strong expertise in C++ and Python. Prior experience with OMS/EMS infrastructure, FIX protocol, and market data systems is highly desirable. *This role is not eligible for visa sponsorship* Responsibilities:Collaborate with investment teams to develop infrastructure for new systematic strategiesDesign and maintain high-performance trading and order management systemsBuild and improve backtesting and simulation frameworks for automated strategiesImplement real-time market data processing and integrationDevelop and optimize straight-through-processing (STP) systemsEnhance and maintain trading platform performance and reliability Qualifications:5+ years of experience in trading system or low-latency software developmentStrong C/C++ development experience on Linux platformsProficiency in Python for scripting and systems integrationExperience with strategy automation and backtesting environmentsKnowledge of EMS/OMS architectures and STP workflowsReal-time market data development experienceBachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or equivalent experience

title: Data Engineer II (NYC)
descriptionHtml:
Healthcare quality is declining and soaring costs are crushing American families and businesses. At Garner, we've developed a revolutionary approach to evaluating doctor performance and a unique incentive model that's reshaping the healthcare economy to ensure everyone can afford high quality care. By providing organizations relief from surging healthcare costs, we've experienced rapid adoption in the market and have more than doubled our revenue annually over the last 5 years, becoming the fastest growing company in our space. To support our continued growth, we're expanding our team by over 50% each year, seeking exceptional talent to shape our unique, award winning culture (for example, USA Today Top Workplaces 2025) designed to cultivate teamwork, trust, autonomy, exceptional results, and individual growth that creates an inflection point in your career.

About the role:

We are looking for a Data Engineer II to support our technical teams by ensuring secure access to data within our organization. The ideal candidate for this role will have strong technical and stakeholder management skills, as well as the desire to be a hands-on contributor to building out an enterprise-grade data platform from the ground up.

This is a hybrid role and will require up to 3 days in Garner's New York City office.

Responsibilities will include:

  • Collaborate with senior engineers to build and support the data platform and pipelines that power our business
  • Collaborate across disciplines to produce high-quality datasets and reports
  • Partner with engineers across Garner to define and implement coding standards, common libraries, and shared tooling
  • Partner with Data Science, Researchers, and Product Managers to convert ideas into reliable, performant production systems
  • Protect our users' privacy and security through best practice

Our Stack and Tooling:

AWS, Snowflake, Argo, dbt, Terraform, Airbyte, JetStream

Ideal candidate has:

  • 2+ years of software engineering experience
  • 2+ years of experience building data platforms and pipelines in a fast-paced environment
  • 2+ years of experience with SQL
  • 1+ years of experience of observability tooling such as Cloudwatch, Datadog, Prometheus
  • 1+ years of experience with container technologies such as Kubernetes, Docker
  • Experience with data warehouse technologies such as Snowflake, RedShift, or DataBricks
  • Experience building distributed systems and data processing environments
  • Experience with orchestration technologies such as Argo, Airflow
  • Conceptual thinking ability to understand and decompose abstract problems
  • An aptitude to learn new technologies and tools quickly

What we look for at Garner:

  • Mission First: Our mission is to transform our healthcare system, delivering high quality and affordable care to all. Everything else is secondary.
  • Expect Extraordinary: Our mission is audacious, so we will only succeed by producing exceptional results. We continually push ourselves and each other to new heights and beyond our comfort zones.
  • Courageous Communication: Transparency and candor are imperative to realizing our potential as an organization and as individuals—even when uncomfortable. Many companies talk about these values. We live them.
  • Supportive community: We know that people do their best work and learn the most when they feel genuinely supported and cared for. It's also more fun that way.

The target salary range for this position is: $120,000 - $160,000. Individual compensation for this role will depend on a variety of factors including qualifications, skills and applicable laws. In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible to participate in our equity incentive and competitive benefits plans.

Fraud and Security Notice:

Please be aware of recent job scam attempts. Our recruiters use getgarner.com email domain exclusively. If you have been contacted by someone claiming to be a Garner recruiter or a hiring manager from a different domain about a potential job, please report it to law enforcement here and to candidateprotection@getgarner.com.

Equal Employment Opportunity:

Garner Health is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and values diversity in the workplace. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, reproductive health decisions, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, genetic information, political views or activity, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Garner Health is committed to providing accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at talent@getgarner.com.

title: C++ Low Latency Trading Systems Dev-NYC- 150-300K Base+Bonus
descriptionHtml:
C++ Low Latency Trading Systems Developer - Manhattan, New York - 150 - 300 K Base Plus Bonus

A trading firm in NYC is hiring C++ engineers to their low latency trading systems technology team. Relative experience in finance is ideal, but the team is open to excellent low latency candidates from out of industry. Excellent C++ experience is a must with STL/Boost, Linux/Unix, etc.

Anticipated annual base salary range is around 150 - 300 K plus bonus.

EOE Statement: Specialist Staffing Group is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Our consultants are truly specialised— focusing on regional market requirements. This allows us to provide organisations with market-specific advice, and place the right professionals into the right projects.

We deliver a high-quality service that is fully compliant, regularly audited, and meets regulations and standards locally and globally. title: Associate Software Engineer - Data Intelligence
descriptionHtml:
Addepar is a global technology and data company that helps investment professionals provide informed guidance for their clients. They are seeking talented junior software engineers to work on innovative data initiatives and contribute to the development of their financial data platform.


Responsibilities

  • Help shape the future of data management in the financial world by contributing to a state-of-the-art financial lakehouse.
  • Create innovative solutions that address the evolving needs of the financial industry, enabling our clients to make data-driven decisions with confidence.
  • Design, develop, and deploy cutting-edge automated workflows and tools that drive operational efficiency, minimize manual errors, and deliver exceptional client experiences.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate automated solutions with existing systems and tools, ensuring data integrity, seamless workflows, and minimal disruptions.


Qualification


Required

  • Hold a Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field, with a strong foundation in computer systems, programming languages, and software development methodologies
  • Proficient in Python programming, with a focus on automation, scripting, and data manipulation
  • Strong ownership of your work and a willingness to take on new challenges
  • Eager to learn and grow with our team, with a focus on automation, data science, and innovation


Preferred

  • experience with PySpark, Databricks, or other big data technologies
  • experience with UI frameworks such as Streamlit or Dash
